publication.abstract: Probe defects are a major source of noise in gene expression studies. While existing approaches detect noisy probes based on external information such as genomic alignments, we introduce and validate a targeted probabilistic method for analyzing probe reliability directly from expression data and independently of the noise source. This provides insights into the various sources of probe-level noise and gives tools to guide probe design. Â© 2011 IEEE.
publication.journal: IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics
publication.title: Probabilistic analysis of probe reliability in differential gene expression studies with short Oligonucleotide arrays
